Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Irving-Las Colinas has more Fortune 500 companies than any city in the United States on a per capita basis.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that having more Fortune 500 companies per capita indicates economic prowess or prosperity without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Irving-Las Colinas does not have the most Fortune 500 companies per capita, as clarified by the Abbott spokesman who stated that Abbott misspoke and meant to say Irving-Las Colinas has the most Fortune 1000 companies per capita.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as the Irving-Las Colinas Chamber of Commerce initially made a claim about having more Fortune 1000 Headquarters per capita but later removed it from their website after being contacted by PolitiFact Texas.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the claim, such as other cities or towns having a higher company-to-population ratio than Irving, according to the analysis conducted by PolitiFact Texas.
